p.s: In my opinion, the movie's version is also faithfullfaithful because the clear change of the atmosphere is very good demonstrated.
In the movie the scene is at the restaurant with the Carter's family but the pull-over of Maverick is basically the same.
He stays polite and tries to protect his family in each way possible.
I think it is not important who argues with Maverick.
The important point is that Maverick did the same thing as he told his kids to do, if the police pulls you over.
In my opinion it is nice to see how the family fights for each other to protect Maverick and everyone else.
Both versions have the same purpose/function for the story and demonstrate police violence especially of a black cop.
In summary one can say that the movie's version is still faithfullfaithful because it has the same effect on the story.
I prefer the movie's version over the version in the novel because the cohensioncohesion, the violence and the danger is better demonstrated.
